main

Class PointerKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.PointerKey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Key_H

    public class PointerKey
extends java.lang.Object
implements Key_H
    The PointerKey class handles the input and interaction logic for the game. It processes touch events, checks button presses, and manages movement.

    • Field Summary

      • checkButton

        public int checkButton(int check_no)
        Checks if a button is pressed based on the given check number.
        Parameters:
        check_no - The check number to identify the button set.
        Returns:
        The index of the button if pressed, otherwise -1.

      • checkButton

        public int checkButton(int check_no,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Checks if a button is pressed based on the given check number and coordinates.
        Parameters:
        check_no - The check number to identify the button set.
        x - The x-coordinate of the touch event.
        y - The y-coordinate of the touch event.
        Returns:
        The index of the button if pressed, otherwise -1.

      • isSelect

        public boolean isSelect(int x,
                        int y,
                        int w,
                        int h)
        Checks if the given coordinates are within the selection area.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the selection area.
        y - The y-coordinate of the selection area.
        w - The width of the selection area.
        h - The height of the selection area.
        Returns:
        True if the coordinates are within the selection area, otherwise false.

      • selectListSY

        public void selectListSY(int len,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int w,
                         int kw,
                         int kh,
                         int dis,
                         int sel)
        Selects an item from a list based on the touch coordinates.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the list.
        x - The x-coordinate of the list.
        y - The y-coordinate of the list.
        w - The width of the list items.
        kw - The width of the selection area.
        kh - The height of the selection area.
        dis - The distance between list items.
        sel - The selected item index.

      • selectMenuX

        public byte selectMenuX(int len,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int w,
                        int h)
        Selects a menu item based on the touch coordinates.
        Parameters:
        len - The length of the menu.
        x - The x-coordinate of the menu.
        y - The y-coordinate of the menu.
        w - The width of the menu items.
        h - The height of the menu items.
        Returns:
        The index of the selected menu item, otherwise -1.
